'''Goshtasb''' is an open-world [[NPC]] located in [[The Palace of Alcazarzaray]], [[Sumeru]].

He is the butler of [[The Palace of Alcazarzaray]] and can be found at the entrance of the building.

==Dialogue==
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Goshtasb:''' Ah, welcome, please take a seat.
:'''Goshtasb:''' I shall introduce you when the [[Dori|Lord]] returns.
:{{DIcon}} I don't see any empty seats.
::'''Goshtasb:''' Yes, yes, sorry for the inconvenience.
::'''Goshtasb:''' The [[Dori|Lord]] built such a big palace yet with no place for guests to wait at the gate. I found it confusing as well.
::'''Goshtasb:''' Please wait. I will make sure to report to her about this.
:{{DIcon}} The Lord?
::'''Goshtasb:''' Ah, so you don't know who lives here?
::'''Goshtasb:''' That's funny. If you don't know who owns this place, then who are you here to see?
::'''Goshtasb:''' I can't be of help if you don't know who you're looking for. Now, if you'll excuse my lack of decorum.
:{{DIcon}} Have a good day.
::'''Goshtasb:''' Alright. Stay safe.{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
* {{Lang|{{w|Vishtaspa}}|ae=𐬬𐬌𐬱𐬙𐬁𐬯𐬞𐬀}} also known as ''Goštāsb '' is the Avestan-language name of a figure appearing in {{w|Zoroastrianism|Zoroastrian}} scripture and tradition, portrayed as an early follower of {{w|Zoroaster}}, and his patron, and instrumental in the diffusion of the prophet's message.
